chat.text:
What‚Äôs new in Mimestream 1.0? | Mimestream

Mimestream 1.0 introduces a range of enhancements and new functionality making the app more powerful and integrated with Gmail. New features include profiles, notification schedules, account colors, filters, vacation responder, label and star drafts, contact colors and more.

- Organizing Multiple Accounts
- Profiles - Group accounts into separate profiles
- Notification Schedules - Set active hours for each profile
- Focus Filters - Specify which profiles can deliver notifications while in a specific focus
- Account Colors - Choose a color for each account to make it easier to spot messages
- Deeper Gmail Integration
- Filters - Create and manage Gmail Filtersdirectly within the app
- Vacation Responder - Edit and activate Gmail vacation response from Mimestream
- Label and Star Drafts - Label or star messages directly in the compose window
- Google Contact Colors - Sync the Google-assigned monogram image color to the app
- Other Improvements
- Template Variables - Write templates with predefined or custom variables
- Unread Messages - Quickly check your unread messages with the menu bar extra
- Conversation View Message Selection - Reply to messages by clicking on them in the conversation view
- Winmail.dat Decoding - Decode winmail.dat attachments and display the contents directly in Mimestream
- Mimestream 1.0 is available for download.

‚ö†Ô∏è Podman Desktop 1.0: Local container development made easy | Red Hat Developer - https://developers.redhat.com/articles/2023/05/23/podman-desktop-now-generally-available

Podman Desktop 1.0: Local container development made easy | Red Hat Developer

Red Hat has launched Podman Desktop 1.0, a user interface tool for managing containers. The product abstracts out the configuration of the underlying environment, providing a lightweight option for container management. The tool includes many features for managing containers and working with Kubernetes. It includes support for single-node OpenShift, an extension for the cloud-based OpenShift environment the Developer Sandbox, and an option for using Kind as an alternative container orchestration tool.

- Podman Desktop is a lightweight container management tool that provides a user-friendly interface for managing containers and working with Kubernetes on a local machine
- The tool abstracts away the configuration of the underlying environment
- It simplifies managing multiple containers in one place and can onboard new developers more easily
- It includes an out-of-the-box Kubernetes environment based on Kind and allows users to work natively with Kubernetes objects
- Podman Desktop integrates with Red Hat OpenShift Local
- It allows for a kind to be used as an alternative container orchestration tool
- It includes an extension for the Developer Sandbox for Red Hat OpenShift, enabling users to deploy applications to a cloud-based OpenShift environment
- The company plans to improve Podman Desktop with more capabilities to help users work with containers and more support for Kubernetes objects

Cloudflare Extends Support to Open-Source Projects with Free Cloudflare Pro Plan

Cloudflare has revamped its open source sponsorship program to be more inclusive. Any non-profit and open-source project can apply for Cloudflare's sponsorship, which includes the Cloudflare Pro Plan, specific product access (subject to approval), and resources/support through the community forums and Discord server. To apply, projects must operate on a non-profit basis and include a link back to Cloudflare's homepage.

- Cloudflare has revamped its open source sponsorship program to be more inclusive
- Any non-profit and open-source project can apply
- Benefits include the Cloudflare Pro Plan for free and resources/support through the community forums and Discord server
- Projects must operate on a non-profit basis and include a link back to Cloudflare's homepage
- Specific product access is subject to approval
- This is not for any event sponsorships
- Cloudflare has stepped up its open source project sponsorship game with this move

RedPanda –Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞, –∫–∞–∫ –≤—Å–µ –¥—É–º–∞—é—Ç. –ö–∞—Ñ–∫–∞ –ø–æ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–µ –∏ —Å—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–µ–µ –Ω–∞ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏—Ö –º–∞—Å—Å–∏–≤–∞—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö

Kafka vs Redpanda Performance - Do the claims add up? ‚Äî Jack Vanlightly

Redpanda, a Kafka clone, claims superior performance due to its thread-per-core architecture and use of C++, but a benchmark test conducted by a distributed systems engineer found the claims to be exaggerated. While Redpanda occasionally outperformed Kafka, it generally underperformed and deteriorated significantly under minor tweaks to the workload.

- Redpanda claims superiority over Kafka, but these claims have not been verified by the Kafka community.
- A benchmark test found that Redpanda's claims were exaggerated, and Redpanda generally underperformed and deteriorated significantly under minor tweaks to the workload.
- Redpanda occasionally outperformed Kafka, but this was not the norm.
- Redpanda was unable to reach 1 GB/s with TLS, conflicting with its own benchmarks.
- The benchmarking methodology was audited and found a few issues, such as Java 11 being used instead of 17 for Kafka.

[8/15] +3 –æ—Ç –ê—Ä—Ç–µ–º –ë–æ–±—Ä–æ–≤
–†–µ–ª–∏–∑ Mimestream 1.0 –∏ –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å–∫–∞ –∑–∞ 50$ –≤ –≥–æ–¥ :(
https://mimestream.com/blog/mimestream-launches

Mimestream 1.0 is here! | Mimestream

Mimestream has launched its public 1.0 version after over 2 years of beta testing, with a mature, reliable and feature-rich service using the Gmail API. The service adds over 10 features that the company has developed over the past few months, including triage functionality, profile and inbox features, sustainability and productivity tools and alerts. A 14-day free trial is offered, with a subscription fee of $49.99 per year or $4.99 per month after that.

- Mimestream 1.0 delivers a feature-full experience from Gmail API, on top of macOS
- Built on the latest Apple software
- Includes top email client features including inbox categories, snooze, filters, search, and labels
- Write emails effortlessly with support for templates, reminders, code blocks, smart lists, markdown substitutions, undo-send, and even synced signatures
- Offers an enterprise solution for team coordination with plans for multiple seats available and bundled billing
- Available exclusively from the company website with a 14-day free trial
- Pricing starts from $49.99 per year or $4.99 per month, with 40% off for new users, and enterprise team pricing available

–Æ—Ç—É–± –∂–¥–µ—Ç —á–∏—Å—Ç–∫–∞((
https://blog.google/technology/safety-securit...

Updating our inactive account policies

Google will update its inactivity policy for personal accounts to 2 years, after which it may delete the account and its contents, including Google Workspace and Google Photos. The change aligns with industry standards and limits the amount of time Google retains unused personal information. Before deletion, multiple notifications will be sent to the email address and recovery email. The policy applies to personal Google Accounts only, and not for organizations. Existing subscription accounts and those with YouTube videos will not be deleted.

- Inactive accounts are vulnerable to security threats.
- Google will update inactivity policy to 2 years for personal accounts and may delete the account and content.
- Notifications will be sent before deletion and will not apply to organization accounts, existing subscriptions, or accounts with YouTube videos.
- Google is aligning with industry standards around retention and account deletion.
- Signing in at least once every 2 years will keep an account active.
- Activity includes email, Google Drive, YouTube, Google Play Store, and signing in to third-party services.
- The change is designed to limit the amount of time Google retains unused personal information.
